thread.title: Icahn, Deason want at least $40 per share for Xerox

title: Icahn, Deason want at least $40 per share for Xerox
text:
May 7, 2018 / 6:16 PM / Updated 22 minutes ago Icahn, Deason want at least $40 per share for Xerox Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
(Reuters) - Activist investors Carl Icahn and Darwin Deason would consider a bid for Xerox Corp XNX.N of $40 (29.50 pounds) per share, or a split with Fujifilm ( 4901.T ) that left the company independent, to resolve an ongoing proxy fight, they said in a letter on Monday. Billionaire activist-investor Carl Icahn gives an interview on FOX Business Network's Neil Cavuto show in New York, U.S. on February 11, 2014. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo
The letter comes after Xerox on Friday appealed a New York court ruling to block its deal with Fujifilm Holdings ( 4901.T ), just hours after the printer and copier maker announced that its ousted CEO and directors would remain in place.
Xerox was not immediately available to comment on the letter. Reporting by Laharee Chatterjee in Bengaluru; Editing by Anil D'Silva
